choices.A: The administrator will receive a notification that there is both a Classifier and Incident Type set for that integration instance.
choices.B: The Incident Type will be ignored, and incoming incidents will be classified according to the Classifier.
choices.D: Both the Classifier and Incident Type will classify incoming incidents.
choices.C: The Classifier will be ignored, and incoming incidents will be classified according to the Incident Type.

questions.question_text: What happens if both a Classifier and Incident Type are configured in an integration instance's settings?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
"If no classifier exists, the incident type will be set in this field. If a classifier is selected, it will take priority."
Correct response should be B: classifier will take precedence. Only one config apply.

Selected Answer: BDE
BDE is Correct

choices.E: Which tabs appear and in which order
choices.A: Which users have permissions to view the tabs
choices.B: Which roles have permissions to view the tabs
choices.D: The information and how is it displayed

questions.question_text: You can customize most aspects of the incident layout, including which three of the following? (Choose three.)
Who is permitted to create and submit content to the Marketplace?

choices.D: All users with the correct XSOAR Role and Permissions
choices.A: Only users with a valid Github account
choices.B: Any user who has signed up through the dev portal
choices.C: Any user who has a live.paloaltonetworks.com account

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Verified on the XSOAR console (Users and Roles > Roles > Marketplace > View Marketplace > Contribute to Marketplace)

questions.question_text: Reliability scores in XSOAR range from A through F. What do A and F stand for?

choices.A: F - Reliability cannot be judged, A - Completely Reliable
choices.B: F - Not reliable, A - Usually Reliable
choices.C: F - Not usually reliable, A - Fairly Reliable

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A: https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/integrations/dbot 
A+ - 3rd party enrichment 
 A - Completely reliable 
 B - Usually reliable 
 C - Fairly reliable 
 D - Not usually reliable 
 E - Unreliable 
 F - Reliability cannot be judged

questions.question_text: Newly created subplaybooks do not have any inputs, or outputs. What is necessary to make them functional? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Define input key in the subplaybook task. Map context values to pull from parent playbook.
choices.D: Open the subplaybook and add inputs or outputs in the Playbook triggered task.
choices.B: The output of the previous task automatically becomes the input of the subplaybook.
choices.C: Map inputs and outputs to the parent playbook and the subplaybook will use the same values.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
finally a correct answer

Selected Answer: AD
A D is correct
